Mathematical Reflection

In this Unit, we use proportional relationships to investigate probability and solve problems. At the end of this Investigation, what do you know about probability? About proportional relationships?

Students can use area models to represent situations to find the probability of occurrences. Students can use 10 by 10 grids as an area model to find probability of occurrences using percents. Students can use theoretical probabilities from area models to scale up or down to make predictions. Students can find long-term averages. Students can determine the probabilities for binomial events.
